00005 #pragma once
00006 
00007 
00008 namespace PDI
00009 {
00010    class Element;
00011 
00012    /*** The CreateInstructionTreeAndFillDataDictionary function is called by 
00013    * the calling code (either the Main.cpp file in cajun test folder or the
00014    * dissector.cpp file in babelshark include folder) after the PDI file
00015    * has been read by the Read function.
00016    * 
00017    * The purpose of this function is to simplify the calling code, so
00018    * it doesn't need to know the details about creating the instruction
00019    * tree or about about filling the data dictionary.  For example, it
00020    * is important that the Data Dictionary is filled before the 
00021    * Instruction Tree is created.  This function will ensure that happens.
00022    * 
00023    * First it will call the StaticTypeCollection::FillDataDictionary 
00024    * function to fill the Data Dictionary with all the statictypes that were
00025    * in the PDI File.  
00026    * Then it will call the DynamicTypeCollection::FillDataDictionary function
00027    * to fill the data dictionary with all of the dynamictypes that were 
00028    * in the PDI File. 
00029    * Then it will instantiate the a TreeVisitor to create the Instruction Tree.
00030    * Finally, it will call singleton destructors to delete the StaticTypeCollection
00031    * singleton and the DynamicTypeCollection singleton.
00032    * 
00033    * The two paramters passed into this function are needed by the TreeVisitor
00034    * constructor and accept function.
00035    ***/
00036    void CreateInstructionTreeAndFillDataDictionary(const Element& elemRoot, bool bDisplayOutputToScreen = false);
00037 
00038 } // End namespace
